name: ink
content:
ink noun [C or U]
(LIQUID)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B1 coloured liquid used for writing, printing, and drawing: a bottle of ink blue/black/red inkin ink Please write in ink, not in pencil. The book is printed in three different coloured inks.
More examplesFewer examplesShe was disappointed to see her essay returned with a mass of corrections in red ink.When you fill in the form, please write clearly in black ink.

ink noun [C or U]
(DECORATION)
informal tattoos (= patterns that are made on the skin using needles and ink): I have only been tattooing for nine months but people seem to like my ink.

Idiom
the ink is not dry/still wet
ink verb [T]
(PUT INK ON)
publishing, art
  specialized to put ink on something: The printing plates have to be inked before they will print on the paper.

ink verb [T]
(DECORATE SKIN)
informal to tattoo someone (= decorate their skin with patterns using needles and ink): Here are some important points to note before you get inked.

colored liquid used for writing, printing, and drawing: [ C ] colored inks [ U ] Please write in ink, not pencil.
Add to word list
Add to word list
a coloured liquid used for writing, printing, etc.: The ink had hardly dried on Nationwide's announcement when a rival Building Society reduced its basic mortgage rate to an even lower rate. printer ink See also
red ink
to sign an agreement: ink a contract/deal The two sides are getting close to a deal but nothing has been inked yet. Phrasal verb
ink sb/sth in
